original_table_html:
OBJECTIVE Description
OBJECTIVE 12-1 Explain why companies use marketing channels and discuss the functions these channels perform.
Supply Chains and the Value Delivery Network (pp 358–361)
OBJECTIVE 12-2 Discuss how channel members interact and how they organize to perform the work of the channel.
Channel Behavior and Organization (pp 362–368)
OBJECTIVE 12-3 Identify the major channel alternatives open to a company.
Channel Design Decisions (pp 368–372)
OBJECTIVE 12-4 Explain how companies select, motivate, and evaluate channel members.
Channel Management Decisions (pp 372–376)
OBJECTIVE 12-5 Discuss the nature and importance of marketing logistics and integrated supply chain management.
Marketing Logistics and Supply Chain Management (pp 376–383)
summary_markdown: This table outlines five key learning objectives related to marketing channels and supply chain management. It begins with an objective to explain the purpose and functions of marketing channels, introducing the concepts of Supply Chains and the Value Delivery Network. The subsequent objectives delve into the dynamics of channel member interactions and organization, followed by identifying available channel alternatives. The table then addresses the critical aspects of managing channel members, specifically their selection, motivation, and evaluation. Finally, it emphasizes the importance of Marketing Logistics and integrated Supply Chain Management. The structure progresses from foundational understanding to practical application and strategic management within the marketing channel framework.
